Your baby may need treatment 
very quickly. Dial 999 for 
an ambulance or take your 
baby to the nearest hospital 
emergency department.
Problems that could be 
serious
• Take your baby to your GP 
if your baby has a hoarse 
cough with noisy breathing, 
is wheezing, or cannot 
breathe through the nose.
• If your baby is unusually 
hot,	cold	or	floppy.
• If your baby cries in an 
unusual way or for an 
unusually long time or
